response.overview: After the 2008 Wenchuan earthquake, three Christian women volunteered in the disaster-stricken area, offering community services and sharing the gospel. Having lived through China’s economic rise and decline, two terms under Xi Jinping, and the COVID-19 pandemic, they now reflect on their lives over the past fifteen years—including their work, marriages, families, children’s education, and how their understanding of God has changed.
response.title: The Sisters' Ordinary Life
